text:
I will explain here why I chose computer science studies after my baccalauréat.
First, when I was asked what I wanted to do after high school, I did not really know what to say. My favourite subject at school was mathematics, I liked it and I was doing pretty well so I wanted to do something related to it. The only job I was thinking about was mathematics teacher, but I did not really see myself doing that. So I first was a bit lost when I had to choose something to do after high school.
During college, I made an internship at my town's cyberspace. It was only for discovery purposes but I liked it. I also liked times when we were doing algorithms during maths classes in high school. It was not very often but I found that interesting. So when I thought about the future and where I was seeing myself after high school, I remembered these things I found interesting and I told myself it would be a good idea to do computer science studies.
The more I thought about doing that, the more I felt that this was what I would enjoy. There were also other arguments that were convincing me of doing that : there is a lot of job offers in that domain, the salary is quite high from the start and I also had a friend that wanted to do the same studies as me. So I ended up choosing this body of studies.
It appears I made a good choice because I actually am very happy in my studies and my life in general. I met a lot of good people, I made some new friends, I learn very interesting things and I can see myself working in computer science later on :)
